column2: Deweycheetem,  Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken this medication for 3.5 years.Only side effect is dry mouth. I have 8 discs in my back either bulging or detereriated and partial Rotator cuff tear.Iwork as an all trade Skilled maintenance @ wastewater treatment plant.Found that this drug allows me to work without loopy feeling and has left me spasn free even after 8.5 hours of doing heavy physical labor.It's a Godsend for me. Don't get me wrong some times after cool down I feel spasms but when I start moving again it kicks back in. Best thing a DOC ever perscribed me. I tried 4 other relaxers either loopy,foggy,or didn't work to allow me a full day's relief while working!!!

column9: I was rear ended by a semi truck 10 years ago and have had back prolems from it ever since. I was taking Flexeril when ever I had a flare up. And it was working fine. So I can not use it when I have to work, or even drive. It also gives me a drug hang over feeling.

column2: Bill D., 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with "slipped rib" syndrome.13 years ago, my chest was opened to plug a small hole in my heart. When I recovered, after about 6 months I started having bad cramps in the muscles around the rib cage. The bottom line is that occasionally a muscle would ping on a nerve or nerve ending, causing wicked cramps. These cramps would not last very long (10-15 min.) and I would have to get into a position that didn't make the cramp feel so painful; usually I had to lie on my side for a few minutes. I went through more tests than I care to remember gefore the diagnosis was made by my new GP. She prescribed orphenadrine citrate (2/day). This has been a wonder drug for me. I rarely get any cramps.I would certainly recommend it.

column2: love my h.d., 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: prefer relafen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication did indeed make me dopey, but not sleepy as indicated by my physician. It is important to note that Nyquil has the opposite effect on me also. My problem with this medicine is that it made me feel lifeless, but also made my body ache. I awoke with greater stiffness in my neck in the morning and retained fluid which made me have to urinate frequently for the first 5 hours after waking. This medication was prescribed to me for muscle spasm between by shoulders.

column2: kindashort32, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have several different diseases and health issues, however, I do believe this medication helped with some of the spasms in my lower back and some of the pain in my neck from the herniated disk in both areas due to having a disk deteriation disease.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I wrote earlier that I was taking this pill dispite the effects of shakes, dizziness, dry mouth and trouble urinating.  Unfortunately I had to stop due to after time my speech was also effected. No one could understand what I was saying and it was also becoming difficult to put thought into words.  The dry mouth was constant and nothing helped.  The other thing was I was also vomiting 3-4 times a day. Appetite almost nill.  Though the pills worked for my muscle spasm the side effects were just too many to deal with. They were effecting my daily life and being able to interact with family and friends.  This would be a great little pill for short term use but for me it just wasn't worth it.

column2: ekimserrot, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After taking a few pills I did not like the effects.  I felt complete useless.  I was in a dumb funk, didn't want to do a thing.So I started taking them at night before bed and though I suffer from dizziness, shakes, trouble unrinating and still some confusion, it is still much better than taking them during the day.  The muscle spasm have lessened to almost 100%.  But because of my hep c, this is the only pill I can take that is safe for the liver.
